channel.title: No rule against spam?
channel.description:
One of the Ideals.
We do not care about post count alone. If someone has high post count but most of it is spam, we hate them. If someone has a high post count with informative posts, we love them. The higher count, the more we hate/love them.
Rule 6: We don't post misleading links, put appropriate warnings(while there's no specific rules on adult content, if you don't use Not Safe For Work(NSFW) warnings, you will be punished).
Rule 9: Do not post or upload any copyrighted material.
Can't help but see people getting in shit for spam? o.O Might as well make a rule against it.... Take a look for yourself: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,354311.0.html

item.title: No rule against spam?
item.dc:creator: @Jamie1200 Jamie1200
item.description:
@Jamie1200 wrote:

[quote=“krackkid, post:8, topic:410729”]Is this about your 3 threads getting locked?

Spam has never been allowed, I been warned and muted for it before.[/quote]
@Krackkid - Yes, so have I in that matter.
@Encryption - http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,365887.0.html - It clearly states the rules; All the rules fall into the don’t spam category.

Read full topic

item.title: No rule against spam?
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Hell if we even enforced half the rules this forum would be dead.

But thats alright, you guys tend to not do anything extreme

Read full topic

item.title: No rule against spam?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Pretty sure ‘time and effort into our posts’, and the spam/common sense parts work together to make it pretty obvious…

Read full topic

item.title: No rule against spam?
item.dc:creator: @Encryption Encryption
item.description:
@Encryption wrote:

[quote=“m.dog311, post:4, topic:410729”]Ok then…

We’re looking for users that use common sense. For example, we would prefer a user that knows, just because something isn’t on the rules, that it it isn’t necessarily allowed.[/quote]

Not all people would know, this could be the first forum they ever joined. If it’s not on the rules, how will we prevent them from making mistakes?

Read full topic

item.title: No rule against spam?
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

Ok then…

We're looking for users that use common sense. For example, we would prefer a user that knows, just because something isn't on the rules, that it it isn't necessarily allowed.

item.title: No rule against spam?
item.dc:creator: @Encryption Encryption
item.description:
@Encryption wrote:

[quote=“m.dog311, post:2, topic:410729”][quote]Moderators lock topics/remove posts and topics/hand infractions to users at their own discretion as required to foster a positive community. Any disagreement with a staff member’s decision is to be resolved through the use of the PM system. Any public disputes are unacceptable and punishable.
[/quote]
Gf.[/quote]

Not a dispute if I’m asking them to make a rule against it. o.O
Think of it more like a suggestion.

Read full topic

item.title: No rule against spam?
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

Moderators lock topics/remove posts and topics/hand infractions to users at their own discretion as required to foster a positive community. Any disagreement with a staff member's decision is to be resolved through the use of the PM system. Any public disputes are unacceptable and punishable.
A moderators decision is final, if you have a problem with it, pm an administrator. Trying to resolve it through a thread will result in a heavier punishment.
Gf.

However,

Posts should be knowledgeable, try to put some effort into them, it'll save hassle and stop you from looking like an idiot.

I would put spam under that rule right there.

Read full topic
